title: FLASHParticleDataset

content.raw: Particle I/O is a black box to me. I would love it if people looked over the implementation in `io.py` to see if it could be made more efficient. It appears that what will happen is that all of the particles will be loaded into memory.
content.html: Particle I/O is a black box to me. I would love it if people looked over the implementation in io.py to see if it could be made more efficient. It appears that what will happen is that all of the particles will be loaded into memory.

description:
FLASH has particle files that are separate from the grid data files. These files do not contain grid information. We have had various ways of dealing with this in the past that involve associating a particle files with plotfiles.

However, if you don't care about the grid structure and just want to work with the particle data, this PR is for you. It implements FLASH particle files as datasets in their own right, treating them as particle datasets exactly like how SPH datasets are handled in yt. 

Still needs tests and docs.
